channel.title: Graphics card restarting when playing games
channel.description: well yea my card/driver restarts when i play games, such as tf2, css. those are about 10 min between each time and in burnout paradise its every second so its realy ******* annoying so .... umm yea what could be the problem? [b][B](I have tried to update drivers)[/SIZE][/b][/B]

item.title: Graphics card restarting when playing games
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
If you’re shopping at best buy for a new charger don’t buy the dynex/rocketfish piece of shit, the kensington universal chargers are the best by far

item.title: Graphics card restarting when playing games
item.dc:creator: kris193755
item.description:
look at the post above yours, i have checked the power supply, and it is the culprit. Its still working but not at full power. Going to get a new one soon (if it fixes it, which is 99% chance it will cuz i can play normaly without it pluged in) and the GPU temp is ok, its not good norr bad.

Read full topic
item.source: Graphics card restarting when playing games

item.title: Graphics card restarting when playing games
item.dc:creator: MechUnit
item.description:
kris193755:

the Nvidia OpenGL driver lost connection with the display driver and is unable to continue. the application must close error code 8
that was an error that popped up when i started the 64 bit verson (i have 64 bit os)
but didn’t find any problems

EDIT: turns out that it was reltated to adobe photoshop CS5 (the error not the problem)

i had a similar problem 3 years ago when i had my old hardware with a geforce 8600 GTS. there were two problems: first the GPU-cooler was broken. the second was that the power supply didn’t provide enough power anymore for the GPU on the 12V power rail. i’ve found this out with everest ultimate and sisoft sandra. 2 or 3 weeks later the PS died. so maybe you should check your power supply if the GPU-temp is ok.

Read full topic

yea PB is bad but this particular computer suited my gaming and movability needs and i traced the problem to my charger. because when i unplug it i can play fine, so my comp ain’t getting enough juice from it.

item.description:
kris193755:

no i don’t have a ASUS, its an [COLOR=‘Red’]Pacard Bell iPower gx

EDIT: its not because it get too hot (because that would impact heavily on the fps)
and before you say any thing i can play gta iv at high medium quality and it doesn’ happen so it partialy the game partialy the card since its on serveral games for diffrent producers

Well there’s your problem.

item.source: Graphics card restarting when playing games

item.title: Graphics card restarting when playing games
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
Overheating doesn’t necessarily effect the FPS… it often triggers sudden system reboots or stuff like that.

Did you check the system event logs? In the administration tools, you can view these things… perhaps would show up something in there.

Read full topic

item.title: Graphics card restarting when playing games
item.dc:creator: Maverix26
item.description:
See, but with rivatuner, you can’t lower the fan speeds on his lappy, because of how the fans are wired. (Something along the lines of dediicated fans or something, i don’t remember the term.)

I’m almost positive you have an ASUS, and lemme tell you, that’s where you fucked up.

item.title: Graphics card restarting when playing games
item.dc:creator: Maverix26
item.description:
I can almost be positive you installed the incorrect drivers.
If you’re one of those cool kids who tried to play with that 3d-shit technology (Which you might be) Revert to the old driver, or update the driver.
If that’s not the case.

Open up your lappy, and clean it out, because i can bet you’re a dirty pig.

Oh, and retard, your laptop does have a fan.

Read full topic

item.source: Graphics card restarting when playing games

item.title: Graphics card restarting when playing games
item.dc:creator: MikeyCgangster
item.description:
I had the same problem a while back with my gtx 275 initially. It was overheating because I didn’t have a profile for fan speeds to automatically adjust according to temperature when I bought it. Now there are no problems.

Download a driver (I recommend from nvidia) that lets you control fan speeds.

Read full topic

And see if it show’s up any problems…

item.title: Graphics card restarting when playing games
item.dc:creator: Grief_Reaper
item.description:
First off try updating your drivers officially: Here

If that does not work then try unofficial drivers: Here

I had a similar problem with my acer laptops ati x700 card not working well with the official drivers and ended up using the one from omegadrivers. Fixed all my problems.

item.source: Graphics card restarting when playing games

item.title: Graphics card restarting when playing games
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
Clean your fucking computer, especially the heatsink on the GPU.

If that doesn’t help, change the clock speed 50mhz lower, if that doesn’t help put it back and take off 50mhz off the RAM.

If that doesn’t help, get a new GPU!

Read full topic
